skill.name: file-name-wizard
skill.description: Audit all filename and naming conventions in the codebase against CLAUDE.md standards and common patterns. Use when user asks to check naming conventions, audit filenames, find naming inconsistencies, or validate file naming patterns.
skill.summary: Audit all filename and naming conventions in the codebase against CLAUDE.md standards and common pat...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This is a read-only audit tool with no security risks. It only analyzes filenames and generates reports without modifying any files or accessing sensitive data.

content.user_title: Audit filename conventions across your codebase
content.value_statement: Inconsistent naming conventions create confusion and technical debt. This skill systematically audits all filenames against your CLAUDE.md standards and identifies violations.
actual_capabilities: Scans entire codebase for filename patterns
Extracts naming standards from CLAUDE.md files
Generates detailed audit reports with statistics
limitations: Read-only analysis - does not rename files
Requires CLAUDE.md files for explicit standards
Report generation limited to markdown format

use_cases.title: Establish coding standards
use_cases.description: Audit existing codebase to identify inconsistent naming patterns before creating team-wide standards

use_cases.title: Pre-merge quality checks
use_cases.description: Run naming audits before code reviews to catch naming convention violations early

use_cases.title: Legacy codebase cleanup
use_cases.description: Identify systematic naming issues across large codebases to plan refactoring efforts

prompt_templates.title: Basic naming audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Please audit all filenames in this codebase for naming convention violations and inconsistencies

prompt_templates.title: Component naming check
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit the components directory for proper React component naming conventions and identify any violations

prompt_templates.title: Service file patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all service files to ensure they follow the *.service.ts naming pattern and identify outliers

prompt_templates.title: Migration file cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all files with temporary naming patterns like -v2, -new, -old and suggest proper names

output_examples.input: Audit naming conventions in my codebase
output: Medium: 18 files with wrong case convention
Low: 14 files with redundant component suffix

best_practices: Run audits before establishing new naming standards
Use audit reports to create CLAUDE.md documentation
anti_patterns: Ignoring audit results without addressing issues
Using audit to shame developers rather than improve
Running audits too frequently without action

faq.question: Does this tool rename files automatically?
faq.answer: No, this is a read-only audit tool. It identifies issues but never modifies files.

faq.question: What file types does it check?
faq.answer: It audits all files in your codebase including source code, configs, tests, and documentation.

faq.question: How does it know the naming standards?
faq.answer: It reads CLAUDE.md files for explicit rules and analyzes patterns for implicit conventions.

faq.question: Where are audit reports saved?
faq.answer: Reports are saved in the .audits/ directory with timestamps for easy tracking.

faq.question: Can it fix the issues it finds?
faq.answer: It provides specific rename suggestions but does not perform any file operations.

faq.question: Is it safe to run on production code?
faq.answer: Yes, it's completely safe as it only reads files and generates reports without any modifications.
